title: Leading neurologist calls for extended head injury assessments following latest high tackle on Owen Farrell
text:
The neurologist who has been trialling new technology to help quickly diagnose sports concussions has suggested that rugby union’s current head injury assessment should be extended beyond 10 minutes.

England captain Owen Farrell was hit for a second time in 10 days by a red card shoulder challenge in England’s 39-10 win against Argentina on Saturday, but was not sent for a head injury assessment (HIA) before then missing a series of first-half kicks.

Replays confirmed the severity of the blow both to his jaw and the side of his head, even if Farrell later described himself as “fine”.
